author: Daniel Greene
description:
Meta’s AI has officially crossed the line. In this episode, we break down how a massive dataset of pirated books may be fueling major AI models—and yes, your book might’ve been stolen. We also cover the real-world fallout, how AI search engines are failing users, and what this means for authors, readers, and the future of publishing.

Plus, we’ve got huge updates in the world of fantasy and sci-fi—from The Strength of the Few release date, Severance Season 3, One Piece showrunner changes, to a Split Fiction movie and Toxic Avenger trailer!
Meta Publishing Heist (Check if your book was stolen)
🔗 https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2025/03/search-libgen-data-set/682094

AI Search Engines Can’t Cite: https://www.cjr.org/tow_center/we-compared-eight-ai-search-engines-theyre-all-bad-at-citing-news.php

Chatbot Stress Testing: https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/updated-508-Prep-CDT-Issue-Brief-Chatbot-Responses-on-Disability-Rights-and-Voting-FINAL.pdf

title: Meta’s A.I. Book Theft Sparks Industry-Wide Crisis || FN 📰
